latest news.eng_title: US Stock Market Expected to Rise on Thursday
latest news.summary: The US stock market is expected to rise on Thursday after losses in the middle of the week. Nvidia's quarterly earnings are in focus, with the company's stock down 3.5% pre-market after a strong run. However, many analysts expect solid quarterly earnings from the US chipmaker, have raised their price targets, and reaffirmed their positive investment opinions. Salesforce also impressed with its numbers and strong outlook. The Dow Jones Industrial Average is expected to rise 0.7% to 41,393 points, according to broker IG, and is on track to reach its record high of over 41,400 points set on Monday. The Nasdaq-100 is also expected to rise 0.5% to 19,444 points. Nvidia's stock has been affected by investors' doubts about the company's outlook, despite analysts' positive views on its solid and positive earnings. Portfoliomanager Thomas Altmann from QC Partners said that Nvidia's outlook 'disappointed at some points.' A stock strategist noted that Nvidia's strong price increase of 150% since the beginning of the year has driven the entire market rally, but the high expectations for the company's next earnings report made it difficult to meet. Salesforce's stock rose by over 4% pre-market after the company raised its annual targets. Crowdstrike, a cybersecurity company, also exceeded expectations, but its stock fell by 2% pre-market. HP Inc's stock fell by 3% pre-market due to declining profits and missing market estimates. Dollar General's stock fell by 24% pre-market after weak earnings and lowered annual targets, while Dollar Tree fell by 9%. Best Buy, however, impressed with raised targets and its stock rose by 14%.
latest news.title: Aktien New York Ausblick: Neues Dow-Rekordhoch in Sicht

latest news.eng_title: US stocks rise on faster economic growth despite Nvidia nerves
latest news.summary: US stock indices are expected to rise at the opening bell, with the S&P 500 predicted to increase by 0.3%, the Nasdaq by 0.4%, and the Dow Jones industrial average by 0.6%. According to Stephen Stanley, chief economist at Santander US, the bump in GDP figures is due to a sharp upward adjustment to real consumer spending growth, from 2.2% to 2.9%. Stanley believes that the US economy is 'far from an economic downturn', but anticipates a slowdown in the economy later this year and early next year. 'We have some economists declaring that the US economy is in or on the cusp of a recession,' Stanley said, 'but I do not agree with that assessment.'
latest news.title: US stocks rise on faster economic growth despite Nvidia nerves

latest news.eng_title: Disney+ September Releases: 'Agatha Desde Sempre' and More
latest news.summary: Disney+ has announced the list of new releases for September, including the highly anticipated series 'Agatha Desde Sempre' from Marvel. The series follows Agatha Harkness, a powerful witch, as she embarks on a journey with a mysterious teenager to the legendary Witch's Path. Other notable releases include 'Murai In Love', a romantic comedy about a high school student who tries to become the perfect man for his crush, and 'Guga por Kuerten', a documentary about the life of the famous Brazilian tennis player. 'Only Murders in the Building' will also return for its fourth season, with the detectives investigating a new case in Los Angeles. Additionally, 'LEGO Star Wars: Reconstruindo a Galáxia' will premiere, a new series that combines the Star Wars universe with LEGO. 'S.W.A.T. - Temporada 7' will also be released, following the story of a team of elite police officers. 'Os Chávez' will explore the life of Julio César Chávez, a famous boxer, and his family. 'Volta, Priscila' will be a documentary about the disappearance of Priscila, the sister of Vitor Belfort, a famous mixed martial artist. 'Sir Ranulph Fiennes: Volta à Natureza' will be a documentary about the life of Sir Ranulph Fiennes, a famous explorer. 'Resident Alien' will follow the story of an alien who takes on the identity of a doctor in a small town in Colorado. 'Are You Sure?!' will be a documentary about the lives of Jimin and Jung Kook from the K-pop group BTS. 'Agatha Desde Sempre' will be released on September 18, while the other series will be released on various dates throughout the month.
latest news.title: Setembro terá estreia de peso no Disney+! Confira a lista completa de lançamentos

latest news.eng_title: The Great Rotation is Underway: A New Chapter in Falling Interest Rates
latest news.summary: The Federal Reserve (Fed) is expected to reduce interest rates in September, which could have a significant impact on the financial markets. The recent disappointing employment report has strengthened the idea that the Fed will reduce rates in September. The report showed that the US economy created 114,000 non-agricultural jobs in July, which is lower than expected. Investors are now evaluating the chances of a Fed rate cut in September at 100%, up from 64.1% a month ago. A rate cut would be a significant change and would dominate market trends beyond 2025. However, the market is not yet certain, and the Fed may not reduce rates until after the US elections in November or December. The author suggests that investors should be prepared for volatility in the coming months and that the rotation of assets could be significant. The author also notes that the decline of the 'Magnificent Seven' (large tech companies) could be a buying opportunity for smaller companies. The author advises investors to 'think small' and to be prepared for a new chapter in the cycle of falling interest rates.
latest news.title: Bourse : la grande rotation est en cours

latest news.eng_title: Bubble Fest 2024 coming to Cleveland for first time
latest news.summary: Bubble Fest 2024, a global bubble community event, will be held in Cleveland for the first time on September 7 and 8. Organized by Gary Pearlman, aka Dr. U.R. Awesome, the event will feature over 75 bubble enthusiasts from around the world, including record-breakers and performers like Tom Noddy and Blaise Ryndes. The event will take place at Edgewater Park and Wade Oval, with activities including bubble foam parties, food trucks, and live music. Pearlman hopes the event will bring joy to the community and inspire younger generations to pursue their dreams. 'It's just something about bubbles that everybody loves,' he said. 'I don't care if you're 5, 55 or 95, it's just the joy that it brings to everybody is enough for me.' The event is free to attend, but tickets are required for the Bubble Fest Variety Show on September 8.
latest news.title: Bubble Fest 2024 coming to Cleveland for first time

latest news.eng_title: U.S. stocks edge up before Nvidia's earnings report
latest news.summary: U.S. stocks rose on Tuesday, with the Dow Jones Industrial Average increasing by 9.98 points, or 0.02 percent, to 41,250.5. The S&P 500 added 8.96 points, or 0.16 percent, to 5,625.8, while the Nasdaq Composite Index increased 29.06 points, or 0.16 percent, to 17,754.82. The Conference Board reported a consumer confidence index of 103.3 in August, up from 101.9 in July. Analysts are expecting Nvidia's quarterly results, to be released on Wednesday, to set the tone for markets before the key payrolls report on September 6. As Ross Mayfield from Baird said, 'There's very little economic data of importance until after Nvidia, so you really are in a kind of wait-and-see.'
latest news.title: U.S. stocks edge up before Nvidia's earnings report

latest news.eng_title: US Stock Market Indices See Slight Increase on Tuesday
latest news.summary: The US stock market indices saw a slight increase on Tuesday. The Dow Jones Industrial Average, which reached a record high of 41,420 on Monday, remained relatively unchanged at 41,219.82. The Nasdaq 100, which had a weak performance on Monday, saw a 0.39% increase to 19,592.04. The S&P 500 also saw a 0.18% increase to 5,627.02. Investors are waiting for Nvidia's quarterly earnings, which will be released on Wednesday after the market closes. According to Index Radar, investors are cautious until then. Nvidia's market capitalization and recent growth make it a significant player in the market. The company's stock price increased by 2% to $129 on Tuesday, reaching a record high of $141 in late June. The chip sector as a whole saw positive sentiment. Paramount Global lost 6.3% after Paramount Global announced that the bidding process for Skydance, a production company owned by David Ellison, has been canceled. Coca-Cola continued its record-breaking performance, gaining 0.7%. Morgan Stanley has identified Coca-Cola as a 'Top Pick' in the beverage sector, replacing PepsiCo. PepsiCo's shares lost 0.4%.
latest news.title: Am US-Aktienmarkt haben die wichtigsten Indizes am Dienstag überwiegend leicht zugelegt.

latest news.eng_title: Netflix Games Shares New Look at SpongeBob Exclusive
latest news.summary: Netflix Games has announced the upcoming release of SpongeBob: Bubble Pop, a bubble pop puzzle game, on September 17 for iOS. The game features hundreds of challenges and cosmetics to earn, and is described by Netflix as 'a quirky, colorful bubble pop puzzle game' where players can 'blast away all the bubbles causing trouble in Bikini Bottom.' Netflix Games has also announced the release of Squid Game: Unleashed and Monument Valley 3, with the latter being a highly-acclaimed title that will be available to hundreds of millions of players worldwide. According to Bill Jackson, Head of Creative at Boss Fight, a Netflix Game Studio, 'making games based on hit series and films is one of the most exciting opportunities we have at Netflix.' Jennifer Estaris, Game Director of Monument Valley 3, added that 'our goal is to bring our biggest Monument Valley yet to as many people as possible, which is why we partnered with Netflix to deliver the game to hundreds of millions of players around the world as part of their memberships.'
latest news.title: Netflix Games Shares New Look at SpongeBob Exclusive

latest news.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery has renewed the CG-animated preschool series Cuquin for a second season, set to launch in mid-2025 on Max and Cartoonito. Moonbug Entertainment is partnering with Reebok to release a Blippi-branded range of footwear for toddlers and preschoolers, priced between $55-$65. Netflix is launching a new game app, SpongeBob: Bubble Pop, on September 17, following the success of its previous SpongeBob game, SpongeBob: Get Cooking. Singer/songwriter John Legend is releasing a children's album, My Favorite Dream, on August 30, featuring three covers of songs from Fisher-Price toys.
latest news.title: Deals in Brief – August 27, 2024

latest news.eng_title: Dow Closes At A Record Even As Losses For Big Tech Pull S&P 500 And Nasdaq Lower
latest news.summary: The Dow Jones Industrial Average reached a record high, despite losses from big tech companies, leading to a mixed finish on Wall Street. The S&P 500 fell 0.3%, while the Nasdaq composite fell 0.9%. Nvidia lost 2.2%, Microsoft fell 0.8%, Amazon dropped 0.9%, Meta Platforms slid 1.3%, and Tesla lost 3.2%. The Dow rose 0.2% to 41,240, eclipsing its previous high set in mid-July. Nathan Thooft, chief investment officer at Manulife Investment Management, said, 'Recent commentary coming out of conversations with Fed officials shows they care more about the risk of the economy slowing.' Traders are forecasting a rate cut to come at the Fed's meeting in September, with a potential 1 percentage point trim by the end of the year. The stock market is coming off a two-week winning streak, with the S&P 500 and Dow within striking distance of notching new highs. This week, corporate earnings and the government's latest inflation reading will be key indicators for investors.
latest news.title: Dow Closes At A Record Even As Losses For Big Tech Pull S&P 500 And Nasdaq Lower

news knowledge.eng_title: Every Western Coming to Tubi in September 2024

Title: A Fistful of Dollars
The Good, the Bad and the Ugly
For a Few Dollars More
The Magnificent Seven

news knowledge.summary: Tubi will be adding a variety of Western films to its platform in September 2024, including the Dollars Trilogy by Sergio Leone and Clint Eastwood. The trilogy consists of A Fistful of Dollars (1964), For a Few Dollars More (1965), and The Good, the Bad and the Ugly (1966). Additionally, The Magnificent Seven (1960) will also be available to stream on September 1. The films will be released on the following dates: September 1: A Fistful of Dollars, For a Few Dollars More, The Good, the Bad and the Ugly, The Magnificent Seven, and other Western films; September 15: no specific date mentioned for the other films. 'The Dollars Trilogy would be incomplete without The Good, the Bad and the Ugly, which is arguably the best of the three films,' according to the article. 'The addition of The Good, the Bad and the Ugly to Tubi is a godsend for Western fans since it allows them to watch the entire trilogy uninterrupted.'
news knowledge.title: Every Western Coming to Tubi in September 2024

news knowledge.eng_title: The Magnificent 7: Must See, Must Do, August 28-September 4

Organization: Old Stone House Museum & Historic Village

news knowledge.summary: The Magnificent 7: Must See, Must Do, August 28-September 4, features a variety of events and performances in Vermont. Miranda Henne will perform at Warren's Phantom Theater with her unique blend of classical and modern music, accompanied by Greg Liszt on the banjo. The play 'No Exit' by Jean-Paul Sartre will be performed at Stone Valley Arts, while the Old Stone House Museum & Historic Village will hold its annual Twilight Stars Party. The Mad River Valley Rotary will host the Great Duck Race, and the Vermont International Film Foundation will screen the documentary 'Sugarcane'. Additionally, author Lee McColgan will read from his memoir 'A House Restored' at Norwich Bookstore, and Vermont potters Jeremy Ayers, Kate Butt, and Dan Siegel will showcase their work in the exhibit 'Facets' at Axel's Frame Shop & Gallery.
news knowledge.title: The Magnificent 7: Must See, Must Do, August 28-September 4

news knowledge.eng_title: Experts warn AI bubble may soon burst
news knowledge.summary: The AI bubble may be bursting, according to experts, after a substantial one-day crash on the stock exchange on August 5, with AI-related businesses heavily impacted. The 'Magnificent Seven' - Alphabet, Amazon, Apple, Meta, Microsoft, Nvidia, and Tesla - saw a combined loss of over $650 billion in market cap. Experts, such as Richard de Chazal of William Blair, believe that the AI hype bubble is popping, while others see it as a natural correction. Brook Dane of Goldman Sachs described the situation as 'a little bit of a leap of faith' and stated that AI businesses need to show more in the future, particularly in applications that use the technology in a more profound way than coding and customer service chatbots. 'You get these waves of both investment digestion and hype-reality,' Dane said. 'And the two of them play out across a multi-year horizon.'
news knowledge.title: Experts warn AI bubble may soon burst

news knowledge.summary: Analysts are divided over whether the recent market turbulence is a temporary blip or a sign of a return to value investing. Creative Planning strategist Charlie Bilello describes the recent rotation as 'one of the most epic rotations in market history', where cheaper stocks soared while the 'magnificent seven' and growth stocks plummeted. Bilello notes that growth stocks' outperformance over value had widened to levels unseen since the dotcom bubble in March 2000, setting the stage for value stocks to outperform their growth counterparts by near-record levels. Most agree that July's rotation was long overdue, but value investors think this is just the start, while growth-minded enthusiasts see it as a mere intermission before the Big Tech show resumes. 'This is just the start,' said value investors, in contrast to growth-minded enthusiasts who see July's performance as a 'mere intermission' before the Big Tech show resumes.
news knowledge.title: Magnificent seven tumble amid 'epic' rotation

news knowledge.eng_title: Experts Warn of Bursting 'AI Bubble' as US Tech Market Experiences Downturn
news knowledge.summary: Experts warn of a bursting 'AI bubble' as the US tech market experiences a downturn. The Nasdaq has seen its worst losses in two years, with the 'Magnificent 7' - Apple, Meta, Alphabet, Microsoft, Amazon, Nvidia, and Tesla - being the main drivers of the decline. The 'Glorreichen Sieben' have lost over $1 trillion in value since mid-July, with the S&P 500 index experiencing its worst losses since 2022. The decline is attributed to weak US economic data, rising recession fears, and the ongoing conflict in the Middle East. Jochen Stanzl, chief analyst at CMC Markets, says, 'The expectations for the 'Glorreichen Sieben' are simply too high.' Arne Rautenberg, fund manager at Union Asset Management, adds, 'The price movements were sometimes extreme and may have gone too far down - especially since there were often no fundamental reasons on the company side.' Investors are shifting their portfolios to focus on smaller companies and 'standard' values, as they worry that the high investments in AI may not pay off in the short term. 'The necessary and extremely high investments in data centers will not quickly pay off,' says Mirko Maier, technology analyst at Landesbank Baden-Württemberg. 'There are simply not enough AI applications that generate revenue.' Goldman Sachs and Sequoia have also warned of a bubble, with Elliot stating that AI is overvalued and many applications are not yet mature.
news knowledge.title: Experten warnen vor Platzen der KI-Blase: Ist das der Start des Crash auf Raten?

news knowledge.eng_title: Silicon Valley Gears Up for Crucial Earnings Week
news knowledge.summary: The tech industry is gearing up for a crucial earnings week, with Microsoft, Meta, Amazon, and Apple set to report their quarterly earnings. The market has been rotating out of Big Tech, with investors seeking returns in other sectors. The so-called Magnificent Seven, which includes the aforementioned four tech firms, plus Alphabet, Nvidia, and Tesla, have been driving the market's growth, but their share prices have been falling. The AI bubble has been compared to the 1990s tech bubble, and investors are waiting to see if the heavy investment in AI will pay off. The rotation to other sectors is likely to continue, with Goldman Sachs projecting a narrowing gap between Big Tech's earnings-per-share growth and the S&P 500's median annual EPS growth. The week will also see a jobs report and a Fed meeting, which may bring about an interest rate cut.
news knowledge.title: Silicon Valley Gears Up for Crucial Earnings Week

news knowledge.eng_title: Expert Warns of KI Bubble Burst: 'People Will Lose Money if They Don't Exit'
news knowledge.summary: Experts are warning of a potential bubble burst in the market, driven by the massive rally of KI-related stocks. The Magnificent Seven, a group of megacap companies, have seen their stock prices surge, with some experts predicting a further 22% increase in 2024. However, others are skeptical, warning that the bubble could burst and cause investors to lose money if they don't exit the market. The article highlights the concerns of some strategists on Wall Street, who believe that the KI boom is unsustainable and will eventually lead to a crash.
news knowledge.title: Experte läutet Alarmglocken: Das könnte die Blase zum Platzen bringen

news knowledge.eng_title: MARKT USA/Wall Street expected to recover with interest rate debate
news knowledge.summary: The US stock market, particularly Wall Street, is expected to recover from its recent decline due to the upcoming debate on interest rates. The shift from technology stocks to other sectors could reverse by the end of the week, as futures on the technology-heavy Nasdaq suggest a strong opening on the cash market. The Personal Consumption Expenditures (PCE) price index, which will be released before the market opens, will be closely watched. According to Derren Nathan, Head of Equity Analysis at Hargreaves Lansdown, 'hopes for a rate cut in September remain high, and today's PCE inflation data will be closely watched.' Technology stocks are considered highly sensitive to interest rates and may react to changes in speculation. The 'Magnificent 7', the seven most capitalized technology titles, are all trading higher before the market opens. However, Nathan notes that the recent decline in these seven stocks is not comparable to the dot-com bubble, as these are financially strong companies that dominate their category.
news knowledge.title: MARKT USA/Wall Street dürfte mit Zinsdebatte auf Erholung gehen

news knowledge.eng_title: The End of the Golden Stock Market Era?
news knowledge.summary: The US presidential election is causing uncertainty in the financial markets, with the Vix index, a measure of market volatility, reaching its highest level since the US regional bank crisis in the spring of 2023. The uncertainty is fueled by the withdrawal of Joe Biden and his endorsement of Kamala Harris, leaving the outcome of the election open. Additionally, investors are concerned about the potential bursting of the 'Magnificent Seven' bubble, a group of tech companies that have driven market gains in the first half of the year. The Deutsche Bank analysts believe that the current market situation is reminiscent of historical patterns, with the S&P 500 often experiencing a sharp decline after a prolonged period of growth. They also point out that September has historically been a month of high market losses in recent years.
news knowledge.title: Das vorläufige Ende der goldenen Börsenzeiten

news knowledge.eng_title: Stocks Slide Before High-Stakes Megacap Earnings: Markets Wrap
news knowledge.summary: Stocks fell at the end of the week, with technology leading the losses, ahead of a critical week of earnings from megacap tech companies. The S&P 500 dropped 1% and the Nasdaq 100 fell 1.1%. The 'Magnificent Seven' megacaps, including Tesla and Alphabet, are expected to report earnings next week. Analysts are looking for strong earnings and softening inflation to reverse the market's recent weakness and spark a new leg higher. However, there is a risk of a setback for the equities this summer due to weaker growth data, dovish central bank expectations, and rising policy uncertainty. Investors are flocking to US equities, expecting a September rate cut and a Trump presidency, but some strategists warn of a 'buy rumor, sell fact' opportunity after the rate cut.
news knowledge.title: Stocks Slide Before High-Stakes Megacap Earnings: Markets Wrap
